comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The delegation from the Democratic National Convention in Baltimore officially notified New Jersey Governor Woodrow Wilson of his nomination for the Presidency at the Governor's official summer residence at Sea Girt, New Jersey, on August 7, 1912. This link will take you to a page with a photo of the delegation in front of the house, and shows, among others, Wilson and the V-P nominee, Thomas R. Marshall of Indiana -- and also includes a recorded excerpt of the speech Wilson delivered on that occasion: www.woodrowwilsonhouse.org/index.asp?section=timeline&...
